```scss
protected Long doInBackground(URL...urls) {
    for (int i = 0; i < urls.length; i++) {
        url = urls[i];
        try {
            URLConnection conn = url.openConnection();
            conn.connect();
            totalSize = conn.getContentLength();
            InputStream inputStream = url.openStream();
            BufferedInputStream bis = new BufferedInputStream(inputStream);
            FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory().getPath() + "/forvo_temp.mp3");
            BufferedOutputStream bos = new BufferedOutputStream(fos, 1024);
            byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
            int bytesRead = 0;
            int totalBytes = 0;
            while ((bytesRead = bis.read(buffer)) != -1) {
                totalBytes += bytesRead;
                publishProgress((int) (totalBytes / totalSize * 100));
                bos.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
            }
            bis.close();
            bis = null;
            bos.close();
            fos.close();
            fos = null;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
    return 0L; // Don't know what to do with this
}
```
This code reads the input stream in chunks of 1024 bytes and calculates the progress as a percentage of the total file size. It then publishes this progress to the onProgressUpdate() function, which updates the progress dialog.

The code also closes the input and output streams after use to release resources.

This allows you to update the progress dialog with the current status of the download.
